title: LepEU: European Lepidopteran Population Genomics Consortium

yaml.title: LepEU: European Lepidopteran Population Genomics Consortium

markdown.markdown:
```{=html}
  1. Home
  2. Species
``` Sampling is currently structured in Phases as LepEU scales up capacity. If you wish to suggest species, please contact us. ## **Phase 1**: n=13 species This set is from 2024, including 5 of the European Biodiversity Grassland Indicator species. Goal for 2025 is to complete this sampling across collection hubs. - *Aglais io* - *Aglais urticae* - *Anthocharis cardamines* - *Callophrys rubi* - *Coenonympha pamphilus* - *Gonepteryx rhamni* - *Lasiommata megera* - *Maniola jurtina* - *Melitaea cinxia* - *Pararge aegeria* - *Pieris napi* - *Pieris rapae* - *Polyommatus icarus* ## **Phase 2**: n=12 species Expands species to now include all of the European Biodiversity Grassland Indicator species. - *Cupido minimus* - *Cyaniris semiargus* - *Erynnis tages* - *Euphydryas aurinia* - *Lycaena phlaeas* - *Ochlodes sylvanus* - *Phengaris arion* - *Phengaris nausithous* - *Polyommatus bellargus* - *Polyommatus coridon* - *Spialia sertorius* - *Thymelicus acteon* ## **Phase 3**: We are actively working to extend our sampling and regional sampling hubs to represent the full range of Lepidopteran biodiversity across all of Europe, especially including a range of moth species. If you wish to suggest species for continental scale population sampling, please contact us. # Resources for Identifying Species Some species can be difficult to tell apart to distinguish between males and females. Below is a collection of links that might be useful in helping you distinguish species. Some of these links are specific to a region. - [Turkish Butterfly Monitoring Scheme](https://butterfly-monitoring.net/tr/node/124) with identification materials! More to come ...

```{=html}
  1. Home
  2. Species
``` # Sampling overview Sampling is currently structured in Phases as LepEU scales up capacity. If you wish to suggest species, please contact us. ## **Phase 1**: n=13 species This set is from 2024, including 5 of the European Biodiversity Grassland Indicator species. Goal for 2025 is to complete this sampling across collection hubs. - *Aglais io* - *Aglais urticae* - *Anthocharis cardamines* - *Callophrys rubi* - *Coenonympha pamphilus* - *Gonepteryx rhamni* - *Lasiommata megera* - *Maniola jurtina* - *Melitaea cinxia* - *Pararge aegeria* - *Pieris napi* - *Pieris rapae* - *Polyommatus icarus* ## **Phase 2**: n=12 species Expands species to now include all of the European Biodiversity Grassland Indicator species. - *Cupido minimus* - *Cyaniris semiargus* - *Erynnis tages* - *Euphydryas aurinia* - *Lycaena phlaeas* - *Ochlodes sylvanus* - *Phengaris arion* - *Phengaris nausithous* - *Polyommatus bellargus* - *Polyommatus coridon* - *Spialia sertorius* - *Thymelicus acteon* ## **Phase 3**: We are actively working to extend our sampling and regional sampling hubs to represent the full range of Lepidopteran biodiversity across all of Europe, especially including a range of moth species. If you wish to suggest species for continental scale population sampling, please contact us. # Resources for Identifying Species Some species can be difficult to tell apart to distinguish between males and females. Below is a collection of links that might be useful in helping you distinguish species. Some of these links are specific to a region. - [Turkish Butterfly Monitoring Scheme](https://butterfly-monitoring.net/tr/node/124) with identification materials! More to come ...
